intro: Sarcostemma andinum, commonly known as the Andean milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Sarcostemma andinum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
